channel.title: Docs on Padhana Documentation & Examples
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on Padhana Documentation & Examples

item.description: Connectors Connectors basically take a source and provide a list of file locations (implementing the iterator pattern). Connector Setup Write some stuff about how to set up a connector. Provide an example.

Structure of a parsed document Document A Document is the base representation of an unstructured source object, it consists of metadata and then a content object. A document is used as the formal representation for a source file or binary object, and should contain features (such as text, layout, visual elements) that can then be used in Padhana to try and enable rich interaction with the document for re-structuring it, training or labelling etc.
Example One How example 1 is amazing This is a placeholder for example 1.
Example Two How example 2 is amazing This is a placeholder for example 2.

Examples A little write up about the 2 examples and the wide ranging uses of Padhana. Example One Write brief description and link to Example One Example Two Write brief description and link to Example Two
Parsers Parsers take a path to a source file and convert that file into a Document. Parser Setup This will contain information on how to set up a parser & examples.

Stores Once you have documents in parsed you can store them in a type of store to allow quick and easy access. Store Setup This will contain information on how to set up a document store with examples.
